channel.title: Path Of Exile - The true successor to Diablo 2
channel.description:
http://www.pathofexile.com/
Amazing game, amazing good fun. I'm in the beta and enjoying it more than any other ARPG since D2.
Discuss.

item.title: Path Of Exile - The true successor to Diablo 2
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Wow! The UI in that video is fucking sexy! It does look like a great step up from diablo but at the same time I love the similar features. Looting corpses, the inventory interface, health/mana interfaces, etc.

Looks awesome man; wish I had more time for video games…

item.title: Path Of Exile - The true successor to Diablo 2
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:9, topic:415964”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=517909.msg3762693#msg3762693 date=1316987962]
Wow looks amazing

How can I play? Lol…
[/quote]Closed beta, either get invited by an existing beta member (who has an invite key), lurk their forums for a beta key contest, follow their twitter/facebook (keys pop up by devs from time to time), or wait for the random beta invite timer on main page to choose you! (it randomly selects a forum members every 25 minutes, with a 10x bigger chance of it choosing you if you are active and posting on the forums).[/quote]

Well that sucks. I just wanted to play a game.

item.source: Path Of Exile - The true successor to Diablo 2

item.title: Path Of Exile - The true successor to Diablo 2
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:2, topic:415964”]How do you find all of these games still in beta?[/quote]I was linked to this game from another forum actually.

To my surprise it’s really well polished for a beta, and the Itemization system is a blessing. Same goes for the “skill forest”. It’s basically a passive skill tree for your stats, as well as modifiers. Instead of assigning stat points at level up, you choose a circle in the massive tree.

To put that skill tree into perspective, here’s the size of it:

140gbw4.jpg886×946

Each one of those circles is a stat/skill upgrade.

Ability Skills are actually gems in this game, used just like sockets in Diablo 2. There are three different “types” of gems, one for each of the three attributes (strength, dexterity and energy). Sockets will share these attributes, and some items only take strength gems for example. It’s a pretty ridiculously complex system as it allows you to mix/match skills as you please and enhance them with “support” gems in some cases. You might have a frost nova gem, if you have a dexterity socket connected to it on the item, you can improve it with a gem for increased speed for example, or if you have a projectile split gem, you can have it fire more projectiles.

The possibilities are endless basically, which in turns leads to endless fun!

Read full topic
item.source: Path Of Exile - The true successor to Diablo 2

Google. Its a great invention.[/quote]

Don’t be snarky. You Google ‘rpg beta’ you get shit games

item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

Path of Exile

Path of Exile

Path of Exile is a free online-only action RPG under development by Grinding Gear Games in New Zealand.

Amazing game, amazing good fun. I’m in the beta and enjoying it more than any other ARPG since D2.

Discuss.
